theory_metadata.source_work: Framing: Toward Clarification of a Fractured Paradigm (Entman)
theory_metadata.original_purpose: Explain how information presentation affects audience understanding and interpretation of issues and events

telos.primary_purpose: Analyze how communication frames shape audience perception, interpretation, and evaluation of issues through selective emphasis and exclusion
secondary_purposes: Identify frame elements that influence audience understanding
Predict frame effects on attitude formation and change
Analyze strategic framing in political communication
Understand frame competition and resonance factors
telos.theoretical_scope: Communication influence on cognitive interpretation and evaluation processes
telos.domain_applicability: Political speeches, media content, policy discussions, persuasive communication, issue presentations

classification.tier_justification: Explains how frames influence interpretation and predicts audience responses to different frame presentations

frames.definition: Organizing principles that select and highlight particular aspects of reality while obscuring others

frame_elements.definition: Specific components that constitute frames and guide interpretation

audiences.definition: Recipients of framed communication who interpret and evaluate information

frame_effects.definition: Changes in audience cognition, evaluation, or behavior resulting from frame exposure

frame_functions.problem_definition: Identifies what is at issue and what needs attention
frame_functions.causal_interpretation: Explains who or what is responsible for the problem
frame_functions.moral_evaluation: Provides judgments about the problem and responsible parties
frame_functions.solution_recommendation: Suggests remedies or improvements to address the problem

episodic_frames.definition: Focus on specific events or individual cases

thematic_frames.definition: Focus on general conditions and systemic issues

conflict_frames.definition: Emphasize disagreement and opposition between parties

framing_processes.frame_building: Process by which frames are constructed and developed
framing_processes.frame_setting: Process by which frames are transmitted to audiences
framing_processes.frame_effects: Process by which frames influence audience responses
framing_processes.frame_feedback: Process by which audience responses affect future framing

step_1_applicability_assessment.description: Evaluate text suitability for framing analysis

criteria.interpretive_content_present: Issues or events requiring interpretation and evaluation
criteria.selective_emphasis_evident: Clear choices about what to highlight or obscure
criteria.frame_elements_identifiable: Presence of keywords, metaphors, concepts that shape interpretation
criteria.audience_directed_communication: Content intended to influence audience understanding

step_1_applicability_assessment.scoring: 0.0-1.0 scale based on presence and clarity of framing elements

step_2_frame_identification.description: Identify dominant and competing frames used to present issues
frame_extraction: Identify explicit frame labels and categories
Extract implicit frames from patterns of emphasis
Assess frame coherence and internal consistency
frame_categorization: Assess frame dominance and subordination patterns

step_3_frame_element_analysis.description: Analyze specific elements that constitute identified frames
element_extraction: Determine key concepts and their definitions
element_assessment: Assess element consistency across frame usage
Analyze element emotional and evaluative content

step_4_frame_function_analysis.description: Analyze how frames perform their four key functions
function_analysis: Problem Definition: What issues are identified as problematic?
Causal Interpretation: What causes are attributed to problems?
Moral Evaluation: What judgments are made about problems and actors?
Solution Recommendation: What remedies are suggested or implied?
function_assessment: Identify gaps or weaknesses in frame performance

step_5_frame_resonance_assessment.description: Evaluate factors affecting frame effectiveness and audience resonance
resonance_factors: Cultural compatibility with audience values and beliefs
Cognitive accessibility based on audience knowledge
Experiential resonance with audience life experiences

step_1_frame_competition_analysis.description: Analyze competition between different frames for the same issue
competition_analysis: Identify alternative frames for the same issues
Assess relative strength and dominance of competing frames
Analyze strategic frame choices and positioning

step_2_frame_effect_prediction.description: Predict likely audience responses to identified frames
effect_prediction: Interpretive effects: How will audiences understand the issue?
Evaluative effects: How will audiences judge actors and actions?
Behavioral effects: What actions might audiences take?
Attitude effects: How might audience attitudes change?

step_3_strategic_framing_assessment.description: Evaluate strategic aspects of framing choices and effectiveness
strategic_analysis: Identify framing objectives and intended effects
Assess framing consistency with communicator goals
Evaluate framing adaptation to audience characteristics

step_4_frame_evolution_analysis.description: Analyze how frames develop and change over time
evolution_analysis: Identify frame stability vs. adaptation patterns
Assess frame learning and refinement processes
Evaluate contextual influences on frame development

internal_consistency.frame_identification_coherence: Frames properly identified with clear boundaries and characteristics
internal_consistency.element_extraction_completeness: All significant frame elements identified and categorized
internal_consistency.function_analysis_thoroughness: All four frame functions analyzed systematically
internal_consistency.resonance_assessment_validity: Realistic evaluation of frame effectiveness factors

theoretical_fidelity.entman_framework_compliance: Adherence to Entman's four-function framing model
theoretical_fidelity.selection_salience_emphasis: Focus on what is selected and made salient vs. what is excluded
theoretical_fidelity.interpretation_influence_focus: Emphasis on how frames shape audience understanding

empirical_validation.frame_element_identification_accuracy: Valid extraction of keywords, metaphors, concepts from text
empirical_validation.function_performance_assessment: Accurate evaluation of how frames define problems, assign causation, evaluate morally, recommend solutions
empirical_validation.audience_resonance_evaluation: Realistic assessment of frame compatibility with audience characteristics
empirical_validation.effect_prediction_plausibility: Credible prediction of frame influence on audience responses

predictive_validation.interpretation_effect_prediction_accurac: Valid prediction of how frames will shape audience understanding
predictive_validation.evaluation_effect_forecasting: Accurate prediction of frame influence on audience judgments
predictive_validation.behavioral_response_anticipation: Valid prediction of audience behavioral responses to frames
predictive_validation.frame_competition_outcome_prediction: Accurate prediction of which frames will dominate in competitive situations
